citations.narrative:
A male, adult rabbit housed exclusively outside has a plant pot as a shelter with a large, slanted opening which does not
provide adequate shelter from rain or snow. The pot is large enough for the rabbit to curl inside, but the angle of the
opening leaves a large section without protection from rain and snow. Failure to provide adequate shelter that protects
animals from rain and snow can lead to increased stress and potential illness. Correct by ensuring the rabbit has
adequate shelter that protects him from rain and snow. Correct by 1 August 2023.

A male, adult rabbit housed outside with solid floors is not being provided fresh litter/bedding once a week. The hay
bedding currently in the enclosure has a multiple areas of moisture, built up debris, discoloration and dust from
disintegrated pieces. According to the licensee, the bedding if completely removed and stripped about once a month.
Failure to strip out old, soiled bedding once a week and replace it with clean and fresh litter can lead to a build up of
debris and contaminated material, increasing the risk of disease in the animal. Correct by ensuring all soiled litter in solid
floor enclosures is stripped out and replaced with clean litter at least once a week. Correct by 28 July 2023.

The primary enclosure housing a male, adult rabbit is not being sanitized at least once every 30 days. According to the
licensee, the enclosure is cleaned about once a month but sometimes is less frequent. Failure to sanitize the primary
enclosure at least once every 30 days (or more frequently if necessary) can lead to a build up of debris and contaminated
surfaces, increasing the risk of disease in the animal. Correct by ensuring the primary enclosure for the rabbit is fully
sanitized at least once every 30 days or more frequently if necessary. Correct by 30 July 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
DANA MILLER, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n
